sn35.154:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn35.154:4.3: “Sir, they speak of someone who is ‘accomplished regarding the faculties’.
sn35.154:4.4: How is someone accomplished regarding the faculties defined?”
sn35.154:5.1: “Mendicant, if someone meditates observing rise and fall in the eye faculty, they become disillusioned with the eye faculty.
sn35.154:5.2: If they meditate observing rise and fall in the ear faculty … nose faculty … tongue faculty … body faculty …
sn35.154:5.3: mind faculty, they become disillusioned with the mind faculty.
sn35.154:5.5: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn35.154:5.6: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
sn35.154:5.7: This is how someone who is accomplished regarding the faculties is defined.”
